class.name: Basis
class.description: 3×3 matrix used for 3D rotation and scale. Contains 3 vector fields X, Y and Z as its columns, which can be interpreted as the local basis vectors of a transformation. Can also be accessed as array of 3D vectors. These vectors are orthogonal to each other, but are not necessarily normalized (due to scaling). Almost always used as an orthogonal basis for a [Transform]. For such use, it is composed of a scaling and a rotation matrix, in that order (M = R.S).

method.name: Basis
method.description: Create a rotation matrix from the given quaternion.

method.name: Basis
method.description: Create a rotation matrix (in the YXZ convention: first Z, then X, and Y last) from the specified Euler angles, given in the vector format as (X angle, Y angle, Z angle).

method.name: Basis
method.description: Create a rotation matrix which rotates around the given axis by the specified angle, in radians. The axis must be a normalized vector.

method.name: Basis
method.description: Create a matrix from 3 axis vectors.

method.name: determinant
method.description: Returns the determinant of the matrix.

method.name: get_euler
method.description: Assuming that the matrix is a proper rotation matrix (orthonormal matrix with determinant +1), return Euler angles (in the YXZ convention: first Z, then X, and Y last). Returned vector contains the rotation angles in the format (X angle, Y angle, Z angle).

method.name: get_orthogonal_index
method.description: This function considers a discretization of rotations into 24 points on unit sphere, lying along the vectors (x,y,z) with each component being either -1,0 or 1, and returns the index of the point best representing the orientation of the object. It is mainly used by the grid map editor. For further details, refer to Godot source code.

method.name: get_scale
method.description: Assuming that the matrix is the combination of a rotation and scaling, return the absolute value of scaling factors along each axis.

method.name: inverse
method.description: Returns the inverse of the matrix.

method.name: orthonormalized
method.description: Returns the orthonormalized version of the matrix (useful to call from time to time to avoid rounding error for orthogonal matrices). This performs a Gram-Schmidt orthonormalization on the basis of the matrix.

method.name: rotated
method.description: Introduce an additional rotation around the given axis by phi (radians). The axis must be a normalized vector.

method.name: scaled
method.description: Introduce an additional scaling specified by the given 3D scaling factor.

method.name: slerp
method.description: Assuming that the matrix is a proper rotation matrix, slerp performs a spherical-linear interpolation with another rotation matrix.

method.name: tdotx
method.description: Transposed dot product with the X axis of the matrix.

method.name: tdoty
method.description: Transposed dot product with the Y axis of the matrix.

method.name: tdotz
method.description: Transposed dot product with the Z axis of the matrix.

method.name: transposed
method.description: Returns the transposed version of the matrix.

method.name: xform
method.description: Returns a vector transformed (multiplied) by the matrix.

method.name: xform_inv
method.description: Returns a vector transformed (multiplied) by the transposed matrix. [b]Note:[/b] This results in a multiplication by the inverse of the matrix only if it represents a rotation-reflection.
